smart_goals.description: Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45% of total caloric intake by the end of next month. Monitor and record daily carbohydrate intake using a food journal.
Engage in at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity, such as brisk walking or cycling, five days a week. Track progress using a fitness app or activity tracker.
Take prescribed metformin medication consistently, at the same time each day, to manage blood sugar levels. Record medication intake in a pill box or medication journal.
Check and record blood glucose levels before each meal and before bedtime every day. Share results with healthcare provider during monthly appointments.
Aim for a target blood glucose level of 80-130 mg/dL before meals and under 180 mg/dL two hours after meals. Monitor progress and adjust diet and medication as needed.
Maintain a water intake of at least 8 cups (64 oz) per day. Monitor progress using a water intake tracker and adjust as needed.
